Minor changes. Potential bugs spotted with the help of valgrind.
SolventMap redefined. Now test with DIRAC.

Many things: 1. input parsing script now accepts ProbeRadius only from Medium section  2. keyword Scaling defaults to Yes and takes the scaling factor from the Atom class (to revise probably)  3. Atom class has a radius scaling data member (for now 1.0 for every element)  4. interface functions are separated according to their visibility to the host program (i.e. extern C linkage or not)  5. in Solvent class removed the vector containing the solvent data in favour of the map.
pass install prefix and allow to override libdir with LIBGETKW_LOCATION
Conceptually cleaner way of declaring vdW radii.
Fix a problem with install prefix.
vector<Atom> Bondi doesn't need to have file scope.
Patching for units  must be revised.
Converting Bondi vdW radii from Angstrom to AU.
Merge branch 'dirac-interface' of repo.ctcc.no:pcmsolver into dirac-interface
Reverting explicit conversion of vdW radii in Atom.cpp  use Constants.h instead. ToAngstrom is now the 2010 CODATA recommended value  both in Constants.h and pcmsolver.in
Small fix to pedra printout (units are AU).
Merge branch 'dirac-interface' of repo.ctcc.no:pcmsolver into dirac-interface
Dirty dirty hack to use total potentials and charges.
Richer set of vdW radii from a paper by Cramer and Truhlar.

1. Solved an issue in the radius selection  2. PEDRA.OUT and cavity.off files are always re-created. This avoids having files of huge dimension (e.g. when doing numerical geometry optimizations.) 3. The overloading of operator<< for GePolCavity is a bit different. 4. Added extern C print function  to print some info related to the module in the host program output.
If make install is issued put relevant things in same install directory as parent program.
Smooth build-and-install process  nicely working together with that of the parent program.
INST_LIBDIR updated to correctly configure input parsing script.
Symmetrize PCM matrix for isotropic case.
Added flag -std=c99 for Intel C compiler.

Install prefix of external submodules changed to /external
Added a dummy function to be used to test if linking works correctly.
Update BLAS and LAPACK modules of cmake. We now require at least Eigen 3.0.0
Restructuring configure&compile setup for PCMSolver. Inspired by R.B. and J.J.
Compilers and Math are correctly configured. Thanks J.J. and R.B.
Better CMake configure&build structure. User can now activate Eigen fallback to Intel MKL. Doxyfile properly configured.
Final clean-up of configure&build structure. Switched to python setup script.
Various renaming in source dir hierarchy. Modify CMakeLists.txt to get make install to work properly.
Add -fPIC flag for all compilers (generate Position-Independent Code)
Pass CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS to external projects. This should be done also for Fortran and C compilers (maybe wrapping it in the add_external function)
Solved issue with make -jN. Parallel make now works fine.
Debugged interface for call to CPCMSolver.
Added Google Test Framework for tests.
Added support for unit testing with Google Test.
Added a stub for the Input class. Various minor improvements in structure.
Input class defined  start working on new interface structure.
Mods by Andy Simmonett to correct kt/kt name conflicts.
Desing of Input is now that of a Singleton.
Print info on polarization energy components using printf.
Added UFF radii set  the parsing script has been modified accordingly.
Correct the implementation of Input as a Singleton. Trying to recover the work I lost on the interface.
Recovery: compiles with DIRAC but crashes on execution (I know why  I want to complete the restructuring)
Added an intermediate class in the inheritance hierarchy of the cavities.

Streamlining cavity classes: 1. GePolCavity class is now free from weird dependencies  2. WaveletCavity class is almost there  but I must test against the old (and working) implementation  3. Next step is to apply the CavityFactory in the interface.
Small corrections  mainly trying to understand how a factory works...
Added some syntactic sugar to the SurfaceFunction class. Currently not used in the user interface  some modifications there are needed.

1. Added flag -std=c++0x It's 2013  g++ and Intel have a good support of the new standard. 2. Some more sugar for SurfaceFunction 3. Basic restructuring of Cavity class  to account for the new interface of SurfaceFunction.
1. added unit tests for overloaded operators in surface function class  2. removerd CavityOfSpheres class. This extra layer of indirection did more harm than good.
Dividing responsibility between Cavity and SurfaceFunction
Cleaner structure and better comments in the makeCavity function in GePolCavity class.
1. Changed cavity constructors  to get the Factory to work. 2. Factories belong in the directories of their object type.
Cavity Factory working  but not smoothly enough...

1. CavityFactory works  but it is still untested when creating a WaveletCavity  2. our inheritance hierarchies break the Liskov Substitution Principle. We use RTTI when necessary instead (possibly bad design  but preserves logical integrity)  3. solved a bug in makeCavity for GePol  4. the addition of new spheres by PEDRA is still untested...

SurfaceFunction is now helper class and is only used in the interface  not in the core classes. The rationale is that the core classes should have to deal with base types only  to avoid high coupling between different parts of the code.

WARNING: this is a dirty commit. 1. added a SurfaceMap helper class  will see if I can remove this extra layer of complication  2. interface works with new SurfaceFunction implementation  3. there's lots of printing going on. I commit like this so that I have a checkpoint to refer to in case I break something.
Clean-up of the previous commit. 1. removed all print-outs  2. as expected helper class SurfaceMap is not needed.

Some fixes: 1. new surface functions automagically register themselves in the surface function map upon creation  2. corrected the implementation of the cavity factory  no more clumsy static functions and preprocessor macros  3. removed a leftover in utils/CMakeLists.txt

Documentation is now managed by Sphinx. The breathe plugin will extract documentation from the code via Doxygen and let us put it into Sphinx. The code will be documented in the usual way  Sphinx can then be used for both the programmers' manual and the users' manual.
Working on Doxygen+Sphinx(breathe) documentation of the code.
Removal of using namespace directives and documenting.
Trying to understand the Green's function code and documenting it while I'm at it.

Still trying to get the new infrastructure to work (I think we are close): 1. refactoring of the interface  for the moment just moving things around  2. Green's function classe do not depend any longer on getkw  3. Solver classes do not depend any longer on getkw  4. documenting here and there.
Documenting the include/forward declare strategy to adopt.
Fixes to get pcmsolver running on my Mac.
Clumsy attempt at creating a factory for Green's functions. The templated nature of the GreensFunction object complicates matters a lot.

Compiles with SolverFactory. Next step  use the factory
Extension of all C++ headers in hpp. Some polishing of the code.
Cavity abstract base class stripped down to pure interface. Redefinition of overloaded operator<< for all the cavity classes.

Super big polishing commit. The order of includes IS IMPORTANT  I will document in the programmers' manual how to do it properly. The coupling between wavelet cavity and wavelet solver (issue 368) MUST be solved.
Removed old/commented code in the interface. TODO: write unit tests  re-think the structure of libgreen (Luca's objections)  structure of wavelet part is a bit messy (needs revision).
UFF radii are now in the new structure. Unit tests are disabled on master.
Enable compilation of unit tests in this branch. Add default CTOR to CPCMSolver and IEFSolver classes. Modify GePol cavity tests and add a test for CPCMSolver.

Correct a small warning in CTOR initialization list.
Program to an interface principle applied to the buildSystemMatrix functions. Will extend to wavelet solvers in the next commit.
Add sample test with CPCM and IEFPCM with TsLess cavity. When TsLessCavity is correctly in place everything should work without further effort.
